Coffee Is My Water edition

>Who is /fat/ for?
For poorly sleeping fatties who are working towards a better physique through meaningful hard-work, strategy, and dedication. This is not QTDDTOT, stick to questions on fat loss. Post height and weight when asking for advice.
Join our Fatty Contest: https://www.fattycontest.com/

>What do I do first?
1. Read https://physiqonomics.com/fat-loss/
2. Calculate your Body Fat Percentage: https://fitness.bizcalcs.com/Calculator.asp?Calc=Body-Fat-Navy
3. Calculate your TDEE: https://www.sailrabbit.com/bmr/
Remember to use bodyfat% and use Katch-McArdle Formula with sedentary settings or your TDEE will be too high.
4. Plan your weight loss: https://www.losertown.org/eats/cal.php
5. Track your nutrition with MyFitnessPal (better for packaged food), Cronometer (better for generic food/macros) or LoseIt (great for both).

>Now what?
Count calories, all of them.
Eat about 500-1000 less calories than your TDEE.
Buy scales, be accurate.
Learn to cook. Try to stick to lean protein and green vegetables.
Eat a lot of protein. 0.72g per lb of goal lean body mass.
Doing cardio, even just walking, will improve your health. There is no such thing as a healthy fat heart, but you can offset the risks.
Lifting weights will keep and gain muscle mass and burn fat much quicker. No lifting results in the body burning away muscle AND fat.
Drink more water.
Read the /fit/ sticky: https://liamrosen.com/fitness.html

>DON'T
Eat refined sugars, they're terrible for you regardless of calories.
Eat processed foods.
Drink your calories (alcohol, soda, starbucks).
Freak out over a weight loss stall. Plateaus can last up to three weeks.
"Reward" yourself. Cheat days cheat only yourself.

>Other resources:
Loose skin, gyno & stretch marks: https://weight-loss-side-effects.netlify.app/
Reddit wiki: https://www.reddit.com/r/loseit/wiki/faq

previous: >>69051123

>Advice for new runners
- Try to keep your cadence high (at or around 180 steps per minute)
- Try to keep your heartrate in Zone1/2 (around an average of 55-65% of your max. heart rate)
- Build up speed and mileage SLOOOOWLY (start with 15 minutes, increase time/mileage by 10% per week)
- Yes, it will feel like you're going slow, you are; don't worry about setting good times for at least a couple months
- If you start to feel pain anywhere, stop and rest, then run a shorter distance next time or walk
- Don't worry about form, the human body knows how to run, just do what comes naturally
- If you can comfortably run 6 miles at one time, start thinking about what your goal race is, and look for a training routine for that race.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>69088428
The head you target really depends on the angle of the action in the transverse plane (overhead view).
E.G. The rope pull down and the kickback are both performed with the upper arm upright and elbow fixed to the side, but it's understood that one works the lateral head and the other works the long head. That's because the kickback angle of motion moves the weight straight back, while the pull down moves the weight back at an angle.
You can do the same thing with the overhead extension by moving your elbow on towards your face and moving it straight up, parallel to the sagittal plane, or starting the weight at the opposite shoulder/ back of the neck and lifting it up and out, closer to being parallel to the coronal plane.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>69089228
Smarties and haribo goldenbears are primarily made of dextrose and glucose syrup respectively, which are very easily metabolized during your workout for three primary purposes and key benefits:
>Spikes insulin
Insulin is highly anabolic and is responsible for shuttling nutrients to cells. While exercising, the insulin is biased towards muscle cells rather than fat cells (can be enhanced by metformin, I believe)
>Easily digested
Even compared to sugar (which has fructose+glucose), glucose is practically pre-digested, meaning your body doesn't have to divert energy or blood flow to the gut for digestion
>Helps replenish glycogen stores
If you ever noticed a crazy pump after a carb heavy meal, it's because your glycogen stores are maxxed, as opposed to when you're cutting and "depleted". Every gram of carb holds two to four grams of water (hence the "hydrate" part), so fast digesting carbs with a lot of water will not only maximize your pump, but also replenish stores that you use up over a long workout

There's some solid info on the topic both John Meadows and an episode of "the steroids podcast"

What exactly is 1 2 3 4 plate?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
1 = 1pl8,
2 = 2pl8,
etc.
pl8 means two plates (20 kg + 20 kg) and you also count the bar (20 kg)
so 1pl8 = 3 plates
2pl8 = 5 plates, etc.
(yes, I know it's retarded but lifters are retarded)

exercises: OHP, Bench, Squat, deadlift
all done for 5 sets of 5 reps

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
euro plate is 20 kg / 44 lbs
murican plate is a bit heavier at 45 lbs

"1 plate" = 1 plate on each end of barbell
so "X plates" = 20kg + X*40kg

"1 / 2 / 3 / 4 plate" is 60kg / 100kg / 140kg / 180kg
exercises are overhead press / bench press / squat / deadlift

I have been through some really crazy shit in my life so I know what I am talking about here.

Learn to recognize your thoughts and emotions as nothing more than ephemeral bubbles in your head. They float by; they float away. Sometimes, bubbles will remain in your orbit for a while. They will float away or pop nevertheless.

Every strength can be a weakness. Every weakness can be a strength. It isn’t wise to appear strong in every situation nor is it wise to appear weak in every situation. Learn to think less in terms of rules or didactics. Try to ask yourself what you aren’t seeing as often as possible. You aren’t an executable file. You are a human being. Respond to situations appropriately. The challenge is: there is no steadfast definition of what’s appropriate. At best, there are customs and social mores. Sometimes, difficult situations require letting go and trusting your intuition, even if it seems patently insane what you are about to do. Many of the greatest discoveries have been made that way.
